xxl.core.indexStructures.builder

Class IndexBuilder<Self,ExternInformation>

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.indexStructures.builder.IndexBuilder<Self,ExternInformation>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPropertyListSerializable<Self,ExternInformation>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BPlusTreeBuilder

    public abstract class IndexBuilder<Self,ExternInformation>
extends Object
implements IPropertyListSerializable<Self,ExternInformation>
    With the help of a concrete implementation of the abstract IndexBuilder class it is possible to easily generate index structures or restore them from a storage medium. The construction of this index structure and decision which concrete structure to use depends on the concrete implementation of IndexBuilder and a given concrete implementation of a given configuration. Depending on the chosen configuration and builder a special structure that inherits from the superclass Tree will be generated and returned ready to use.

    XXL provides a set of built-in builders which are accessible through concrete configuration e.g. BPlusTreeConfiguration. By design each builder is inside the concrete configuration and can be executed with the method .getBuilder().create() of the given IndexConfiguration implementation.

    How to add own new builders
    If you want to write your own builder for a new index structure ensure first that this structure inherits from abstract class Tree. After this create a concrete implementation of abstract class IndexConfiguration in which you create getter and setter and also default values for all the customizations for your index structure. Then implement your own IndexBuilder subclass in which you have to implement create(). Inside this method you have to construct and setup your index structure according to the given configuration structure which you designed in the previous step and which is accessible through the protected member mIndexConfiguration.
    See Also:
    Setting up table meta data, A builder for a BPlus tree, Setting up the requirements for a specific index structure, The base class for the index structures

    • Constructor Detail

      • IndexBuilder

        public IndexBuilder(IndexConfiguration configuration)
        Constructs this builder object with a given configuration. This configuration contains all the users needs for the index structure. A need could be if the structures should be stored in memory or on a persistent storage medium. By calling create() an instance of a concrete Tree subclass is initialized depending of these needs and will be returned.
        Parameters:
        configuration -

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public abstract IndexedSet create()
        Builds up a concrete subclass of Tree depending on the given configuration and returns this as super class Tree type object.
        Returns:
        The index structures built up according to configuration needs.
